required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: NICU-TECH RM9L-RS Probe ME Feasibility Study
clinical_study.official_title: NICU-TECH RM9L-RS Probe ME Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: Use of a new ultrasound device designed for babies to look at the catheters in veins and arteries as well as the blood vessel itself. An observational study to assess the the clinicians perception of the ultrasound image quality as a tool to detect catheters in vessels.

detailed_description.textblock: The intent of the study is to confirm the maximum penetration of the NICU-Tech RM9L-RS probe. The investigators collected images on patients with PIV (Peripheral Intra Venous)/PAC (Peripheral Arterial Catheter) and central line catheters. The investigators collected images of deep vessel structures for offline processing to improve NICU-Tech algorithms for vessel segmentation.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Images not adequate to visualize catheter penetration or obtain measurements

primary_outcome.measure: Participants That Fulfilled All Study Procedures.
primary_outcome.description: Acquisition of basic images and video were obtained from study participants who already have one or more catheters in place.

primary_outcome.measure: Vessel Penetration of NICU-Tech RM9L-RS Probe
primary_outcome.description: The algorithmic depth of vessel penetration will be collected.

arm_group.description: Collection of image data with the ultrasound probe.

study_pop.textblock: neonates and infants, from the 23-week gestational (0.5 kg) up to a 6 month old born at term (7 kg), for whom the PIV, PAC, UAC, UVC or PICC catheter insertion is medically indicated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Neonates that are 23 gestational weeks at birth (and greater than 500 grams) to a 6 month old born infant at term (maximum weight 7 kg) who already have one or more lines placed (PIV/PAC/UVC/UACs/PICC) as part of their medical care. NO INFANT WILL HAVE A LINE PLACE FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS STUDY
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neonates that are less than 23 gestational weeks at birth
- Neonates that are 23 gestational weeks at birth but are less than 500 grams in weight
- Patients weighing more than 7 kg.-Patients older than 6 months

clinical_study.keyword: neonates and infants, from the 23-week gestational (0.5 kg)
up to a 6 month old born at term (7 kg), for whom the PIV,
PAC, UAC, UVC or PICC catheter insertion is medically

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This is an observational study where recruitment took place in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit. Enrollment period of June 2010 - November 2011.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: If participants health worsens prior to assignment they were excluded from the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Enrollment was stopped early/terminated, study development stopped and no results were analyzed.
